Posts.Content: Thank you for replying. Yes I have an appointment booked in next Tuesday and should hopefully get the results and treatment plan then. Your right, I just want to know what the next steps are and how bad this is, it’s going to be a tough week I suspect.
Posts.Title: Just been diagnosed, awaiting biopsy results

Posts.Content: Hi all, today I have been diagnosed with breast cancer. I felt a lump in my breast so went to see the doctor and she referred me to the breast clinic. I have been there today and they have given me a mammogram and taken 4 biopsies. They said I have a 30mm lump and a 5mm lump and the other side with some swollen lymph nodes. I am now awaiting the results of the biopsy and can not sleep. To top it off I have been told I have to stop breastfeeding so I have one sore boob from the biopsy and one sore boob from engorgement! I don’t really know what I’m asking, I suppose I’m just looking for positive stories and what to expect.
Posts.Title: Just been diagnosed, awaiting biopsy results

Posts.Content: Well round 6 for me today and my beautiful daughter has decide 5:30 is an acceptable time to wake up! Might have to have a nap in the hospital haha.  Hope the side effects are treating all you new ladies ok, just remember you’ll have more good days than you will bad. We can do this.  XxX
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: Well ladies I’m just about to set off for my ct scan, fingers crossed it’s good news! Got one more chemo to go and then they’ll decide on lumpectomy or mastectomy.  Ps I’m bloody starving and just sat and watched the family eat the lovely spag Bol I’ve made, how unfair is that?!
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: Morning, yes I’m awake feeding the children. Been up all night with such a sore throat, I’m not sure if it’s a reaction to the dye for the ct scan
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: Ms Jolly sorry to hear your having such a rough time. Have you contacted the chemo unit as there’s always something extra they can give you?  Hope your feeling better today xx
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: Well I’m on my way to the hospital  text my friend this morning who works on the ward and she was on call and told me to ring her straight away, she’s triaged me and told me I need to go and be checked, ready for a long day.
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: Hi all, here we are another month into chemo! I’m just coming out the other side of my last lot last Wednesday, been on a mad cleaning spree today as we have CBeebies coming round tomorrow because someone thought it was a good idea to send in an audition tape of her daughter at 3am when the steroids were keeping me awake! Ah well my daughter is super excited and hopefully something to look forward too!  Hope your all doing well ladies, chin up and keep smiling, we got this xx
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: Betty Mango well we need to see a picture of the new puppy now!  We lost our cat on the 13th, just what we all need right now. My poor 4 year old was so upset she ended up in our bed for a few nights bless her, Etta (10 months) is just oblivious to it all.  Im on day 4 of my penultimate chemo so side effects are just kicking in, sore mouth, fuzzy head and achy neck.  Been sat watching crappy American tv all day, I’m sure it helps!  Chin up ladies xx
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: Was going to say the same about the injections, I have to have them to boost my white cells as have children at nursery so not worth the risk with all the bugs. You can get one injection that covers you for the 7 days instead of one daily (it’s more expensive so they probably didn’t mention it) I have a huuuuge phobia of needles so that’s what they’ve given me instead of the daily ones. It’s worth asking xx
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: Hi ladies, hope your all well. I’m suffering with a sore mouth at the moment. They’ve given me some gelclair but to be honest it doesn’t seem to be doing much. I took tablets for oral thrush the last two rounds and I’m tempted to take them to see if that helps. Any words of wisdom?
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: Haha love that Ali owl, I can not wait for the rain!  Well after the morning in hospital I’ve been discharged with some mouthwash (I forget the name but it started with a d) so on the way to pick up the children and do some non baking baking!
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: One more here too! 8th of August is my last one, I’m counting down the days and got a few weekends away booked with hubby and the kids before surgery. Let’s get this done ladies!
Posts.Title: chemo finish line approaching

Posts.Content: Hi all, as many of you know I’ve now finished my chemotherapy and am due for my surgery tomorrow. I went to see the oncologist yesterday who finally had my ct results back (from 6 weeks ago!) and she said I have a very small nodule on my lung. She said she’s not worried about it but I will have to go for another scan in around 6 weeks to check that it’s not growing. I am now petrified that it’s spread to my lungs and that I’m not going to be able to get over this and will be leaving my two girls behind   shes basically said it could be scar tissue from an infection or a million other things but I can’t help but think the worst. I don’t really know why I’m posting this, I don’t have any questions, I suppose I just wanted some reassurance (which I know nobody can actually give me!)
Posts.Title: Lung nodule after ct scan

Posts.Content: Hi all, well I managed to make it to the wedding and was highly surprised by how well I felt. The side effects have well and truly kicked in now though. I’m having a lot of stomach cramps and I am so so bloated, I look like I’m pregnant! My mouth is also sore and just feels generally yucky, I can’t taste anything. I tried some medicated mouth wash but it made me sick (it was the cheaper version so hoping the proper stuff tastes better!) how long should I expect to feel like this? I think it’s the mouth that’s getting me down the most, I love my food and I can’t bloody taste any of it!
Posts.Title: Docetaxel, pertuzumab, trastuzumab

Posts.Content: Spring1 and Aims84 I’m also 31 and have an 8 month old and a 4 year old. I’m already onto my second round of chemo so if you need to private message me please feel free to do so xxx
Posts.Title: *** May 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Hi all as the subject line says I just wanted to on et some honest opinions on the docetaxel pertuzumab trastuzumab regime. Due to tart it tomorrow after 3 rounds of EC and just want to know what to expect. Onco said flu like aches, will they be bad aches? How will the fatigue be compared to EC? My friend gets married on Saturday, I’d love to be able to attend but have prepared myself for not going so honest feedback on your side effects please.
Posts.Title: Docetaxel, pertuzumab, trastuzumab

Posts.Content: Thank you both for your replies, you’ve made me feel slightly better about it. Going for the pert and herceptin today and then docetaxel tomorrow. Bollybees you made me smile when you said rest when you need to, I have a 4 year old and an 8 month old so resting is rare!
Posts.Title: Docetaxel, pertuzumab, trastuzumab

Posts.Content: Hi all, been quiet the past week as my second chemo has totally knocked me for 6 and I’ve struggled to even get out of bed!  LiziX  glad you made it home!  @lucy-B know what you mean about the wig being a rush, I’m now onto my second round and still don’t have one! I’ve been getting by with head scarves and I’ve ordered some funky wigs which are due to come on friday.  Mam to 3 im feeling the same at the moment about my kids not knowing who I am, I had my chemo on Wednesday last week and I’ve been struggling to get out of bed since!  Had a moan to my friend today who is a nurse on the chemo ward about not being able to do this 8 times but she’s assured me it’s the E part of EC that’s making me feel like this and I’ve only got two more of these to go and then I’m switching to docetaxel, pertuzumab and herceptin so Im hoping it’s going to get easier, anyone else had this mix? keep smiling ladies, we can do this! Xxx
Posts.Title: *** May 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Wigs are from the lovely named https://www.thepussydollpalace.co.uk/ don’t let the trout pouts put you off haha x
Posts.Title: *** May 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: With all the talk of wigs....my funky wigs came yesterday, I decided if I’m wearing a wig I’m going to have a choice of about 4 different ones! They are actually alright for £40! Here is me and my 4 yr old sporting them haha
Posts.Title: *** May 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: I can’t figure out how to edit, obviously I meant nodules not modules
Posts.Title: Modules on the lung

Posts.Content: Hi all, been a while since I posted here but my head is spinning right now.  I had a ct scan back in August where they found some nodules on the lung. They basically said they weren’t worried and they would just monitor it.  Ive since had another ct scan and they’re now saying there’s no way of telling for certain if they are or aren’t cancer cells so are now talking about treatment just to be on the safe side. The consultant was basically saying she doesn’t really know what to do, that in her heart of hearts she doesn’t think it is anything to worry about but on the other hand if it is and they don’t treat it it’s obviously going to be a mistake. She’s going to chat to her colleagues and come back with a decision.  My heads just all over right now, I don’t know what to think or do. I thought I had finally finished all my treatment but now to be told I could be going onto pertuzumab indefinitely has just brought my down with a bang.  I don’t really know what I’m asking, I just needed to get it out there I suppose.  XxX
Posts.Title: Modules on the lung

Posts.Content: @Jacks77 are you implying I have a hairy bum?! Haha speaking of hair loss, how long before it starts to go? I’m on day 10 now and no sign yet
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Bigguy if we didn’t laugh we’d cry ey?!! No she hasn’t actually had the wrigglers for a while so I don’t think it’s that.
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Well the chemo ward rang me back and ive been admitted, now hooked up to iv antibiotics!
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: LiziX  id say a digital in ear theomethor which you certainly won’t get from the hospital! You should get one at boots though x
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Googieswife have you rang the chemo unit about your sore throat? I’ve just had a right rollicking off the sister on my chemo unit (who happens to be my friend of 28 years!) because I had a sore throat and didn’t ring them, when they took my bloods my neutrophils were too low and so I got admitted and had to have iv antibiotics  I’d give them a ring if I were you x
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Aw you look fab!! I don’t think I’ll suit being bald at all, my ears are too big haha. I went to try some wigs on today and hated all of them so I think I’m going to go 50s washer woman style haha
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Well I never thought I’d say this but I wish my hair would hurry up and fall out now! It’s shedding thick and fast and I’m sick of waking up in a pile of my hair! Got my second chemo tomorrow so hoping that helps it along.
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Yes I’ve cut it with the clippers, my husband is bald too and now I’m matching my 7 month old daughters hair haha. Just had a call from the hospital to say my neutrophills are too low for tomorrow’s chemo which is annoying, thought it may happen though as the kids have been full of cold and I’ve now got a sore throat and snotty nose! Typical.
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Oh god Dormouse i feel for you, I’m now on my second trip to hospital after my first chemo, was due my second round tomorrow but it’s been delayed as I’m currently hooked up to iv antibiotics. Here’s hoping it’s smooth sailing for us both from here on out
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Hi all, I’m now on day 6 of my first ec cycle and it has certainly been interesting! My sickness meds didn’t work the first night so I was throwing up all night and then pretty much slept for 2 days. I’ve been in hospital yesterday as temp was slightly high but all ok thankfully. The main issue I’m having is my needle/cannula phobia, it’s making me so stressed and physically sick, I threw up everywhere yesterday when they put it in. My mum has rang a hypnotherapist to try and help with the issue, has anyone done this before? I’m a bit worried about what they’ll find in there haha
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: rubyrose im so sorry your feeling the way you are, I think a lot of it is fear of the unknown and once you start your first treatment hopefully things will start looking a little better for you. LiziX  are all your children school age? If so I would say try and rest as much as you can while they are at school. I have a 4yr old and a 6 month old so not much of that going on here! Luckily I have lots of family around to help out and typically my first treatment was the first week of the Easter holidays!  To everyone else who is well on their way, my hair has started falling out today, my 6 month old managed to grab a big chunk is it best to shave it off now? I am going for my wig tomorrow.
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Ladies, how many of you braved the shave? And if you didn’t what did you do? My hair has properly started falling out today and my baby keeps grabbing it and pulling big chunks out so I think I’m going to have to shave it, a little bit scared!
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Well ladies, my hair has pretty much all gone now, it only started falling out a couple of days ago but it’s coming out thick and fast, had a little cry this morning. I’ve got my second round of chemo on Wednesday and I went for some hypnotherapy yesterday to try and help me with my huge phobia of cannulas, fingers crossed it has worked! In the mean time I’ve been bouncing on a giant bouncy castle today with my 4 year old and had lots of laughs! Hope you’ve all managed to enjoy your weekends x
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: No I couldn’t cope with one of those, once the cannula is in I feel queasy until it’s taken out so having one of those in will just make me feel sick constantly. It’s all fun and games hey!
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Congratulations to everyone finishing their chemo, I can’t wait for that but only on my first round of 8! Well I went to see the hypnotherapist and she seems very confidant that she can help me and I’ve got my first session booked in on the 14th so fingers crossed it helps.
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Sooooo, I realise this is far tmi however it’s driving me insane! I’m on my first round of EC and since yesterday I’ve had a really itchy bum (as in hole not cheeks, sorry!) is this a side effect or has my daughter given me worms?! Haha if it is a side effect any advice on stopping it?!
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Was going to try some nappy cream, I have a 6 month old so have a generous supply!  On a different note, how do I tag someone on here? Tried to do it earlier but it seems the old @ trick doesn’t work!
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: rubyrose so sorry for your loss, sending hugs your way xx
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: @LiziX sounds like you are having a rough time of it already, I hope your out soon! Shouldn’t you be in a private room? I was put in one both times I’ve been admitted but maybe that’s because they were treating me for neutrophenic sepsis? I’m off to get my bloods done tomorrow ready for round two of chemo on Wednesday (hopefully it can go ahead this time and I won’t get admitted again!) Much love to you all xx
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: LiziX  how awful for you that you’ve been put in a room with someone who’s got the runs, if you’ve got the energy I really would be kicking up a fuss as they should have you in a private room! How old are your kids? Mine are 4yrs and 7months and I missed them loads when I got admitted and was only in one night so I can’t imagine how you feel! Have the doctors said metastasis to you or are you self diagnosing?!  i went for my bloods today and they have come back all clear so I can now get on with my second round of chemo tomorrow, seems strange to be happy about getting chemo but I just want to bosh them off now and get it done!  Hope everyone is doing well, big love x
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***
